name: Path T Scrotum
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  T1 for cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas with one or no high-risk features is based on tumor size.  
* If there are no high risk features and tumor size is unknown, assign TX

**Note 2:**   T1 and T2 categories are based on size and high risk features and not depth of invasion or extension.  
* TNM includes a T3 category for head and neck skin primaries only

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physician’s statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record.
* If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified and there are no known high risk features, assign TX

**Note 4:** Assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2) based on the tumor size for the following descriptions

    Adjacent connective tissue excluding skeletal muscle
    Confined to scrotum
    Skeletal muscle
    Subcutaneous tissue
    Underlying cartilage

    Adjacent organs/structures
        Male genital organs
            Epididymis
            Penis
            Prostate
            Spermatic cord
            Testis
    Further contiguous extension
    Other organs and structures in male pelvis
        Bladder
        Rectum
        Urethra

    Confined to scrotum, NOS    
    Localized, NOS

**Note 5:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 6:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.
